summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: TCM Greatest Classic Legends Film Collection: Lucille Ball (The Long, Long Trailer / Forever Darling / Room Service / Du Barry Was a Lady)
Review Date: 2013/03/11
Store: Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Today's Deals, Spotlight Deals, Mother's Day Gift Ideas in Movies & TV
Product Description: ['GREATEST CLASSIC FILMS COLLECTION: LEGENDS – LUCILLE BALL The Long, Long Trailer • Forever Darling • Room Service • Du Barry Was a Lady THE LONG, LONG TRAILER (1954) Anyone know how to park this thing? Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz play newlyweds who hit the honeymoon road with a 40-foot house trailer in tow in this crowd-pleasing comedy directed by Vincente Minnelli. FOREVER DARLING (1956) Heaven help them! Ball and Arnaz head for the great outdoors – and so does her guardian angel (James Mason) – in a comedy that asks: “Can marriage survive a camping trip?” ROOM SERVICE (1938) Ball and Ann Miller join the Marx Brothers in a riotous romp about a cash-strapped theatrical troupe trying to nail down a backer for their new Broadway venture. DU BARRY WAS A LADY (1943) Their friendship is a perfect musical-comedy blendship! Ball goes from NYC torch singer to the dream girl of Red Skelton’s wacky, 18th-century-France reverie. Gene Kelly joins the fun, spiced by nifty Cole Porter songs!']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '8 hours and 38 minutes', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'TCMV1000176706DVD', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '8 hours and 38 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 12, 2011', 'Number of discs': '4'}
Review Text: I actually bought this because I wanted the move "The Long Trailer" and figured I might as well get this set with the 4 movies. I love Lucille Ball and now I can watch a movie any time I want....GREAT! I highly recommend this set, especially if you like Lucy.
Review Title: Love Lucille Ball!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Christmas Classics Box Set (Miracle on 34th Street / Jingle All the Way / Home Alone / A Christmas Carol)
Review Date: 2013/03/11
Store: Arnold Schwarzenegger  (Actor),     Sinbad  (Actor),     Brian Levant  (Director),     Chris Columbus  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Holidays & Seasonal, Christmas
Product Description: ['This collection of holiday fun includes a Christmas Carol, Home Alone, Miracle on 34th Street and Jingle on the Way. Director Chris Columbus, Brian Levant, Les Mayfield, Clive Donner star George C Scott, Nigel Davenport, Macaulay Culkin, Arnold Schwarzenegger, and Sinbad.']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Brand': 'TWENTIETH CENTURY FOX HOME ENT', 'Occasion': 'Christmas', 'Theme': 'Religious', 'Cartoon Character': 'Home Alone', 'Target Audience': 'General/trade', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1, 1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 11.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '385661', 'Director': 'Brian Levant, Chris Columbus, Clive Donner, Les Mayfield', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '6 hours and 45 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 7, 2006', 'Actors': 'Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sinbad, Richard Attenborough, Elizabeth Perkins, George C. Scott', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': '20th Century Studios', 'Writers': 'Charles Dickens, George Seaton, John Hughes, Randy Kornfield', 'Number of discs': '4'}
Review Text: Bought it for "Home Alone" to replace a VCR tape. The other 3 movies were just bonuses. Not disappointed at all in my purchase.
Review Title: Great movies
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Grace Unplugged [DVD + Digital]
Review Date: 2014/05/03
Store: AJ Michalka  (Actor),     James Denton  (Actor),     Brad Silverman  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Faith-Based', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, AC-3, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'AJ Michalka, James Denton, Shawnee Smith, Kevin Pollak, Brad Silverman, Chris Zarpas, Russ Rice, Coram Deo Studios, Larry FrenzelAJ Michalka, James Denton, Shawnee Smith, Kevin Pollak, Brad Silverman, Chris Zarpas, Russ Rice, Coram Deo Studios, Larry Frenzel   See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 35 minutes'}
Review Text: We watched this movie with some friends and right at one of the most crucial points (about 15 minutes from the end of the movie) the screen went black. We tried everything we could think of but nothing worked, the DVD just "quit"! We notified Amazon and they sent out a second DVD at no cost to us and provided a return label for the bad DVD. Got together with our friends and re-watched about the last half of the movie (to refresh our memories). Were coming to the spot where it stopped before and were all kind of holding our breath. It reached the same point and sort of " jumped" or paused very briefly - like half second, but then went on. We all just looked at each other when it paused but got a big laugh when it continued. I didn't catch the location number, but it's right after Grace & Quentin are on the beach, then get up and are walking away and Quentin is telling her, basically, what she needs to hear. (I won't say more). Anyway....that little "pause/jump" seems to be a glitch in the recording of the DVD, so be aware!
Review Title: Good movie, but DVD had tech problem
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/02/03
Average Rating: 3.2
Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['J.C. Khoury'], 'Producers': ['J.C. Khoury', 'Trevor Herrick'], 'Starring': ['Noah Bean', 'Rachel Boston', 'Anna Chlumsky']}
Review Text: If I  could give it no stars I would. I didn't watch the movie. It started out so bad I turned it off and looked for something better,  which didn't take much effort at all.
Review Title: So bad I turned it off and found something else.
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
This individual's purchase history reveals a strong preference for classic films, particularly those with comedic elements and iconic actors. High ratings (averaging 4.6 to 4.7) indicate a positive sentiment towards nostalgic content, especially holiday classics and works featuring Lucille Ball. The frequent purchases of movie collections suggest a desire for convenience and value, as evidenced by their willingness to buy entire sets for one appealing film.

The person shows an affinity for family-oriented and faith-based films, indicating a tendency toward wholesome content. Price sensitivity is subtly inferred through their focus on deals and collections, maximizing value with multiple films in a single purchase. However, their experience with a defective DVD suggests that quality matters, as they expressed dissatisfaction with technical issues, resulting in a lower rating for that film.

Overall, this consumer prioritizes nostalgia, value, and quality in their purchases, favoring classic and family-friendly films with a higher average satisfaction rating.

target_interaction.title: Enjoyed it.
target_interaction.text: Nice movie, great for the family. slight surprise ending. Not real exciting or anything, just pleasant.
